intro: Cacalia candicans, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cacalia candicans thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
